interactions.rationale: Announcing the Return of Spontaneous Circulation (ROSC) signals a shift from active resuscitation to post-arrest care. Nursing responsibilities now include maintaining oxygenation (target SpO‚ÇÇ > 94%), supporting blood pressure with fluids/vasopressors, and continuous monitoring for recurrent arrest. According to AHA (2020), the post-cardiac arrest period is highly unstable; vigilance is essential for preventing secondary injury. Nurses also provide reassurance to the recovering patient, bridging the physiologic and psychological aspects of care.
